official_title: A bill to establish a Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights.
short_title: Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights Act of 1991
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues
Federal aid to law enforcement agencies

summary.text: Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights Act of 1991 - Amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to require a 20 percent reduction in certain assistance under such Act for any law enforcement agency which fails to have in effect a law enforcement officer's bill of rights that provides, at a minimum, certain rights with regard to: (1) engaging in political activity; (2) investigations for alleged malfeasance, misfeasance, or nonfeasance of official duty; (3) the representation of law enforcement officers on police complaint review boards; (4) the recovery of damages for civil suits brought for violations of these rights; and (5) advance notice of disciplinary actions to be taken against such officers.
